Package com.example.appify.Model

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.appify.Model.Event
public class Event extends Object
Represents an event with various attributes such as name, date, facility, and more. Allows retrieval of event data from Firestore and provides methods to access event details.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class

    static interface 
    Event.EventAddCallback
    Interface for callback after adding an event to Firestore.

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event(String name, String date, String facility, String registrationEndDate, String description, int maxWaitEntrants, int maxSampleEntrants, String posterUri, boolean isGeolocate, boolean notifyWaitlisted, boolean notifyEnrolled, boolean notifyCancelled, boolean notifyInvited, String waitlistedMessage, String enrolledMessage, String cancelledMessage, String invitedMessage, String organizerID)
      Constructs an Event object with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the event
      date - the date of the event
      facility - the facility where the event takes place
      registrationEndDate - the registration end date for the event
      description - a description of the event
      maxWaitEntrants - the maximum number of wait-listed entrants
      maxSampleEntrants - the maximum number of sample-selected entrants
      posterUri - the URI of the event's poster image
      isGeolocate - whether geolocation is required for this event
      notifyWaitlisted - whether to notify waitlisted entrants
      notifyEnrolled - whether to notify enrolled entrants
      notifyCancelled - whether to notify cancelled entrants
      notifyInvited - whether to notify invited entrants
      waitlistedMessage - the notification message for waitlisted entrants
      enrolledMessage - the notification message for enrolled entrants
      cancelledMessage - the notification message for cancelled entrants
      invitedMessage - the notification message for invited entrants
      organizerID - the ID of the organizer

    • Event

      public Event()
      No-argument constructor required by Firestore.

  • Method Details

    • lottery

      public void lottery(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, String eventID)
      Runs a lottery to randomly select entrants with "enrolled" status from the waiting list of a specified event and updates their status to "invited." The method first checks the number of entrants already accepted and adjusts the number of additional entrants to invite based on the remaining available slots (`maxSampleEntrants - acceptedCount`). The lottery continues to invite entrants until this adjusted limit is reached or no more eligible entrants are available. Additionally, it updates the entrant's status in their Android ID collection under "waitListedEvents" for the specific event.
      Parameters:
      db - The Firestore database instance used to access and update the database.
      eventID - The unique identifier of the event for which the lottery is being conducted.
